![](https://ds0fmzhunbzyk.cloudfront.net/5-nights-in-new-york-city-1.jpg)

I spent 5 nights in New York City Times Square to celebrate New Year’s, spending $0 instead of $9,000. 

5 nights in [“Tempo by Hilton”](https://www.hilton.com/en/hotels/nyctepo-tempo-new-york-times-square/?SEO_id=GMB-AMER-PO-NYCTEPO&y_source=1_ODE0MDczNjItNzE1LWxvY2F0aW9uLndlYnNpdGU%3D) during the busy Christmas/New-Years/Holiday period can cost up to $12,000, depending on the room. In our case, we booked a standard room with Hilton Honors points that would have otherwise cost $6,000.

We got upgraded upon check-in as well, but more on that later. 

In this blog post, I will show you how I used credit cards to make this possible, and how you can do the same. 

First, if you want to check out our trip photos, you can do so [here](https://photos.app.goo.gl/H1wQSJUKPoz6rMk28) (Spoiler Alert: the album also contains our Boston photos. I will write all about our Boston redemption next week).

Let’s get started. 

![](https://ds0fmzhunbzyk.cloudfront.net/5-nights-in-new-york-city-2.jpg)

## 5-Nights in Hilton Tempo Cash Value

We booked the standard rooms that were going for a total of $6,074 if we booked all 5 nights in cash. 

Being Hilton Gold members (through Hilton Surpass card), we were upgraded to “times square view” rooms upon check-in. 

The 5 nights cash price of the upgraded rooms was around $9,000. 

In my wildest dreams I cannot see myself spending $9K for 5 nights, even if that means not staying in Times Square for our first NYC trip.

I mostly wanted to stay in Times Square to see the historic ball drop on the 31st. It was worth it\! If I couldn’t make this happen without points, most likely I would have never experienced something so awesome. 

Okay, so let’s see how I managed a $9,000 hotel stay for free using credit card points.

![](https://ds0fmzhunbzyk.cloudfront.net/5-nights-in-new-york-city-3.jpg)

## 90,000 Hilton Honors Points Per Night

Being a Hilton Gold member (through Hilton Surpass card), I get three important benefits:

1. Stay 4 nights, get 5th night free.  
2. Room upgrade upon check-in, if available  
3. $35 daily food and beverage credit 

Let me talk about (2) and (3) first, then (1). 

I already mentioned (2) \- we received a room upgrade upon check-in. The “times square view” room was beautiful\!

We spent the $35 daily food and beverage credit on water, hot chocolate and coffee from the onsite restaurant. 

Those benefits were amazing, but the biggest win came from the “stay 4 nights, get 5th night free” benefit. Let’s run some numbers. 

Points Per Night \= 90,000  
Total Points for 5 Nights \= 450,000  
Total Points for 4 Nights \= 360,000

Cash Value for 5 Nights (w/o upgrade)  \= $6,000  
Cash Value for 5 Nights (w/ upgrade) \= $9,000

Here are the cents-per-points (CPP) for the standard room.

CPP without 5th night free \= 1.33 CPP  
CPP with 5th night free \= 1.7 CPP

Here are the cents-per-points (CPP) for the upgraded room.

CPP without 5th night free \= 2 CPP  
CPP with 5th night free \= 2.5 CPP

I think it’s fair to say I scored 2.5 cents per Hilton Honors point for my 5-nights stay. 

![](https://ds0fmzhunbzyk.cloudfront.net/credit-cards-photos/amex-gold.png)

## What Credit Cards I Used

There are 2 primary ways you can earn Hilton Honors points:

1. Use AMEX’s Hilton credit cards ([Hilton Honors](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15), [Hilton Surpass](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15), [Hilton Aspire](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15))  
2. Use AMEX’s MR points earning cards ([AMEX Gold](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/referral/personal/gold-card?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~k~u~7~w-1738792791206-1506794106&GENCODE=349992856309180&extlink=US-MGM-USEFULLINKS-copypaste-784-201279-K3QE%3A9919&ref=MDIRTHku7w&v=2&xl=cp19), [AMEX Green](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~k~u~7~w-1738792791206-1506794106&GENCODE=349992856309180&extlink=US-MGM-USEFULLINKS-copypaste-784-201279-K3QE%3A9919&ref=MDIRTHku7w&v=2&xl=cp19), [AMEX Platinum](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~k~u~7~w-1738792791206-1506794106&GENCODE=349992856309180&extlink=US-MGM-USEFULLINKS-copypaste-784-201279-K3QE%3A9919&ref=MDIRTHku7w&v=2&xl=cp19))

When taking approach (1), you directly earn Hilton points in your Hilton account. 

When taking approach (2), you can transfer your MR points to Hilton. Typically, 1MR point equals 2 Hilton points. However, during promotions (which happens 3-4 times annually), 1MR point equals 2.6 Hilton points.

1 MR Point \= 2 Hilton Points (w/o bonus)  
1 MR Point \= 2.6 Hilton Points (w/ bonus)

Which approach did I take? A combination of (1) and (2). 

![](https://ds0fmzhunbzyk.cloudfront.net/credit-cards-photos/hilton-surpass.png)

Primarily, I used 3 credit cards:

1. [Hilton Surpass Card](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15) \- a sign-up bonus of 130K Hilton Points. Another 10K from spending on the card. So, total 140K Hilton Points  
2. [American Express Blue Business Plus](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~k~u~7~w-1738792791206-1506794106&GENCODE=349992856309180&extlink=US-MGM-USEFULLINKS-copypaste-784-201279-K3QE%3A9919&ref=MDIRTHku7w&v=2&xl=cp19) \- earned MR points to transfer to Hilton at 1:2.6  
3. [American Express Gold](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/referral/personal/gold-card?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~k~u~7~w-1738792791206-1506794106&GENCODE=349992856309180&extlink=US-MGM-USEFULLINKS-copypaste-784-201279-K3QE%3A9919&ref=MDIRTHku7w&v=2&xl=cp19) \- earned MR points to transfer to Hilton at 1:2.6. 

If you run the numbers: 

* 140K Hilton Points from the Hilton Surpass Card  
* 85K MR points transferred at 1:2.6 from American Express (earned through AMEX Gold & Blue Business Plus)

That’s a total of 360K Hilton Honors points that I needed to do the booking.

## An Easier Approach You Can Take

If you are still reading, I think it’s fair to assume you want to do something similar. 

You can take a much easier approach\! I will give you the strategy for 5-nights, but if you want fewer nights, just execute part of the plan instead. 

So, 5-nights at Hilton Tempo during New Year’s will cost you 360K Hilton Points. 

### Approach 1: Hilton Credit Cards

Get 3 Hilton credit cards, get the sign-up-bonuses, book your trip (with one extra night\!).

1. [Hilton Honors Card](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15) \- 80K points  
2. [Hilton Surpass Card](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15) \- 130K points  
3. [Hilton Aspire Card](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15) \- 150K points (also gives you an annual free night)

That’s a total of 360K points, as well as a certificate you can use to turn it into a 6-night stay.

### Approach 2: American Express

Get 1 American Express and 1 Hilton card, get the sign-up-bonuses, transfer the points, book your trip. 

1. [Hilton Surpass Card](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15) \- 130K points  
2. [American Express Gold Card](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/referral/personal/gold-card?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~k~u~7~w-1738792791206-1506794106&GENCODE=349992856309180&extlink=US-MGM-USEFULLINKS-copypaste-784-201279-K3QE%3A9919&ref=MDIRTHku7w&v=2&xl=cp19) \- (100K MR or 260K Hilton points)

Once you transfer your American Express MR points to Hilton at 1:2.6, you end up with 390K Hilton Honors points, more than enough to do the booking.

### Approach 3: Slow Accumulation

If you don’t want to sign up for too many cards or don’t want the hassle of hitting minimum requirements for sign-up bonuses, you can do the following. 

1. Pick the right credit cards for your setup  
2. Spend on them to earn points  
3. Eventually accumulate enough to book

In that case, I would recommend the same setup as approach 2\. 

1. [Hilton Surpass Card](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/credit-?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~X~7~1~N-1738792667396-1561104962&GENCODE=349993256973880&extlink=US-MGM-INAV-copypaste-774-201279-K7GE%3A9997&ref=MDIRTHX71N&v=2&xl=cp15) \- 6X Gas, 4X Retail Purchases, 3X Everything Else  
2. [American Express Gold](https://www.americanexpress.com/en-us/referral/personal/gold-card?CORID=M~D~I~R~T~H~k~u~7~w-1738792791206-1506794106&GENCODE=349992856309180&extlink=US-MGM-USEFULLINKS-copypaste-784-201279-K3QE%3A9919&ref=MDIRTHku7w&v=2&xl=cp19) \- 4X Dining, 4X Groceries, 3X Flights

You also get 1 free night certificate when you spend $15K in a calendar year on the Hilton Surpass card.

If you regularly spend in the above 2 cards, you will earn points at a fast enough rate to get 360K points fairly quickly.

![](https://ds0fmzhunbzyk.cloudfront.net/5-nights-in-new-york-city-4.jpg)

## Summary

In short, using either 3 Hilton cards or a 2-card setup (1 Hilton, 1 American Express), you can earn 360,000 points which is enough for a 5-nights stay in Hilton Tempo during busy holiday season.
